chapter.title: About Media Encoding Cluster
chapter.para: The Media Encoding CLuster is a Programm which can be used to Encode Media Files Distributed over Nodes that reduces the Encoding Time.

section.title: Motivation
section.para: Video encoding is highly processor intensive. While the processing power available on standard PCs is continually increasing, so is the complexity of modern audio/video codecs. The Media Encoding Cluster uses a peer-to-peer network as a substrate for sharing the processing power of regular PCs for the purpose of encoding video. This allows nodes the easy construction of video encoding farms from cheap standard PCs.

listitem.para: Generation of process units - the source video file is split into x chunks, where x is the number of reference Frames in the video.
Distribution and encoding - encoding specifications and Media data are sent to each participant node, which decode and encodes the process unit.

Recombination - encoded process units are returned to the distributing nodes and reassembled into a complete encoded video. If process units are not returned due to node failure, they are resubmitted to the network for encoding. This process repeats until all work units are received by the distributing node and reassembled.

section.title: Windows
section.para: To install Media Encoding Cluster on Windows, double-click the installer file and follow the instructions on the screen.
To uninstall, choose Uninstall Media Encoding Cluster from the Start>Programs>Media Encoding Cluster menu.

section.title: Linux and Unix Systems
section.para: To install the server on Linux and Unix based systems, such as Solaris, open a terminal window. Download MediaEncodingCluster-Linux-xxx.sh (xxx is a placeholder for the version) to any directory, and execute the self extracting installer: sudo chmod +x MediaEncodingCluster-Linux-xxx.sh sudo ./MediaEncodingCluster-Linux-xxx.sh You will be asked to agree to the End User License Agreement.
The self-extracting installer will install the files in the current directory. The server will be installed as the root user.
To uninstall: delete the installation directory of the Media Encoding Cluster

section.title: Windows: Command Prompt
section.para: On Windows, Media Encoding Cluster can be started and stopped from a DOS command prompt, from the Start menu or from the Windows Services administrative tool. To start the server from a DOS command prompt, open a DOS command prompt. Change directory (cd) to the bin directory of the server installation. The default location for this folder is: cd MECINSTALLDIR\bin To start the server, type in .\mhive -r and hit return. The startup contains all the server logging statements. To shutdown the server hit "ctrl-c" on the console window. The server can also be started and stopped from the Start menu using the Server Startup and Server Shutdown menu items in the Programs>Media Encoding Cluster program group.

section.title: Windows: Service
section.para: To start the server as a Windows service, open the Settings>Control Panel>Administrative Tools>Services administrative tool and locate the Media Encoding Cluster entry in the list. Next, right click on the entry and select Start from the context menu. To stop the server select Stop from the same context menu. To configure the service to run each time Windows restarts, select Properties from the right click context menu, set Startup type to Automatic and click the OK button to close the dialog.

section.title: Main Concept of the Media Encoding Cluster
section.para: The Media Encoding CLuster is mainly used to Transcode multiple Media Files from one Format into an other Format, these formats will be described by a Profile. To Transcode one File into an other Format, it will be performed over some Watchfolder, watchfolders will be permanently scanned and new Files found in these folders will be imported into the Cluster, these watchfolder can be connected to a Profile, a Profile is mainly the Target Format in which these files will be encoded to. The Watchfolder have a parameter called Output Folder, these folder will be used to write the successfull encoded Files into.
